lines.text: So while no cures can be attributed to '606,' 38 deaths resulted from it's use?
39? You know of another death?
Yes, syphilis. The death of syphilis itself.
Dr. von Behring you have written and lectured against the Ehrlich theory.
Yes, I did, Dr. Wolfert, but you must understand it is the task of science to discover the truth. There is no shame attached to the recognition of error.

[His final message, on his deathbed, to his research team]
There will be epidemics of greed, hate and ignorance. We must fight them in life as we fought syphilis in the laboratory. We must fight, fight. We must never, never stop fighting.
I hope this horse is good and strong. H's going to be very sick.
He used to be a racehorse, doctor - a champion!
If this horse does what we want him to, he'll be the most famous horse in the world.
He's too old to race again.
Well, this is a race against death.

[about his fellow doctors]
To argue with them is like discussing colors with the color-blind.
You assistants seem to be doing all the work. What does Dr. Ehrlich do?
He thinks!
I want no legal advice. This is a question of truth. I'm only trying to help the court understand the real nature of these deaths.
Dr. Ehrlich, I'm afraid your observations are irrelevant to this issue.

[In perplexed astonishment]
Irrelevant?... Irrelevant?

[about his felow doctors]
To argue with them is like discussing colors with the color-blind.

[Angrily]
Ehrlich!
Yes?
You seem in a great hurry.
Well, I must get back to the hospital.
If I were you, I wouldn't bother.
Why not?
Because you are no longer employed there.
